thread.title: Comedy heavyweights come to town
thread.title_full: Comedy heavyweights come to town - San Antonio Express-News

author: Hector Saldana
title: Comedy heavyweights come to town
text:
Stand-up comedy lovers get a 1-2-3 punch with Mike Epps , Gallagher and Shawn Wayans arriving over the next few days.
Mike Epps performs at 8 tonight at the Majestic Theatre on his Real Deal Tour. Epps — Day-Day Jones in the popular “Next Friday” and “Friday After Next” movies; Black Doug in “The Hangover” — has been on a roll lately in the Starz dramatic series “Survivor’s Remorse,” produced by LeBron James and Mike O’Malley . His upcoming movie roles include playing his hero, Richard Pryor .
On the stand-up stage, Epps’ comedy is edgy, sometimes raw and plays off racial stereotypes.
Gallagher performs at 7 p.m. Sunday at the Carlos Alvarez Studio Theater at the Tobin Center for the Performing Arts. Prepare to get dirty and wet when the Sledge-o-Matic-wielding comic does his his thing.
The Tobin folks advise to bring a poncho, a cap or plastic protection for anyone sitting in the so-called splash zone. Early birds get a chance to find seats farther away from the action. Yes, watermelons are still part of the show.
More Information On stage
Mike Epps
When: 8 p.m. today
Where: Majestic Theatre, 224 E. Houston St.
Tickets: $53-$103 through box office, 210-226-5700, ticketmaster.com
Gallagher
When: 7 p.m. Sunday
Where: Carlos Alvarez Studio Theater, Tobin Center for the Performing Arts, 110 Auditorium Circle
Tickets: $39.50-$75, 210-223-8624, tobi.tobincenter.org
Shawn Wayans
Where: Laugh Out Loud Comedy Club, Park North Plaza, Loop 410 at Blanco Road
When: 8 p.m. Thursday through Oct. 11, plus 10:15 p.m. shows Oct. 9-10
Tickets: $25; 210-541-8805, lolsanantonio.com
Named one of the Top 100 comics of all time by Comedy Central , Gallagher arrives with opening act Artie Fletcher .
Shawn Wayans begins a four-night run Thursday at Laugh Out Loud Comedy Club . Wayans has been an influential comedy star since the late 1980s with “I’m Gonna Get You Sucka” and “In Living Color.”
His string of movie hits include roles in “Little Man,” “White Chicks,” and the “Scary Movie” series. Wayans remains a pop culture force, whether hosting the MTV Video Music Awards or goofing on Donald Trump .
He recently called Trump “the white Kanye West ” on “The Cruz Show” on Power 106 in Los Angeles. “He’s always saying something to make you go, ‘What?’ What is wrong with you?’” Wayans followed by saying he wasn’t voting for Trump — or West.
hsaldana@express-news.net
